content:
"If our decisions are guided by a desire to accomplish the most good, we each have enormous potential to create change.

It is not enough to be a righteous vegan, or even a dedicated, knowledgeable vegan advocate.

The animals don’t need us to be right, they need us to be effective.

In other words, we don’t want to just win an argument with a meat-eater, we want to open people’s hearts and minds to a more compassionate lifestyle."

#vegan #veganism #turkey #cows

http://www.satyamag.com/sept05/ball.html

media_attachments.description:
Closeup of one of the cute turkey chicks in a cage, looking straight up at us. A bit blurry, but innocent, curious, but a bit worried expression on his face. 

There were four of them, varying in colors from dark brown to reddish brown, with white underbelly. They were at Agway farm supply store, and already spoken for at the time, a decade ago. I can’t hope enough that they went to a compassionate animal lover.

Two small, adorable, light brown cows in the grassy field, looking straight at us. There are some trees in the distance.

They were grazing afar, but they both came over to where we were. I don’t know their story, but they looked young and slender. It was over a decade ago, before the Trustees of Massachusetts turned the Appleton Farm into a working farm. I still think about these two lovely, gentle creatures.

content:
Hello @breadandcircuses

I think that's just an opinion.

Mine is that our planet is dying because of opinions like yours.

So, you want to preserve your despotic privileges of sapiens supremacism while saying it's all someone else's fault. And you say you wish to motivate action?

My opinion is:

First, go vegan (you should even if there were no climate change): Astronomical amounts of devastation (and suffering) would end.

Second, control all your demand: Those corporations would pump nothing if there were no demand. It's not them, it's us.

Then, once you have stopped being part of the problem, please join us to fight capitalism, borders, authoritarianism and messages like the one you tooted. You will be very much welcome and we will give you lots of love.

#ClimateAction
#ClimateChange
#Degrowth
#SelfOrganization
#Vegan
#Veganism
#Anarchism
#Anarchy
#ComunismoLibertario
@climatechange
@climatejustice
@mutualaid
@anarchism

media_attachments.description: A banner showing the following text on the top of the Extinction Rebellion's logo: "Our planet isn't dying because regular people won't go vegan or only take cold showers. It's dying because a handful of corporations and billionaires profit from pumping astronomical amounts of pollution into the air and water."

content:
Good Morning #Canada
Apparently it's World Plant-Based Burger Day. OK... although I am reducing meat consumption I'm not like to order a plant burger any time soon. Surveys by food manufacturers show that younger Canadians are more likely to eat a plant-based hamburger patty than their older counterparts (me). The Canada meat substitutes market lost some momentum in 2022 but the plant-based protein market continues to grow.

#CanadaIsAwesome #Veganism #WheresTheBeef
https://www.cbc.ca/radio/sunday/meatless-burgers-plant-based-1.6934187

content:
If your #veganism isn’t intersectional, it isn’t veganism at all. You can’t advocate for the liberation of non-human animals while perpetuating racism, transphobia, misogyny, ableism, etc. Make it make sense! 🤨

🌻 https://anajonessy.tumblr.com/post/730703249882120192/if-your-veganism-isnt-intersectional-it-isnt

content:
In #Brazil as elsewhere, animal agribusiness causes immense human suffering (starvation, displacement and disease) through neocolonial forms of enclosure, pollution, worker exploitation - and as the primary source of pandemics.

The food we consume directly affects marginalised people both at home & across the globe.

These injustices are why we understand #veganism as a movement for human #liberation. 3/3

#SocialJustice #Solidarity #Agriculture #Colonialism #Corporations #Globalization #Vegan
